required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Acetaminophen (ACE) in Post-operative Dental Pain
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo- and Active- Controlled, Single-Dose, Efficacy, Safety, and Pharmacokinetics Proof of Concept Study of a Test Acetaminophen 500 mg Tablet in Postoperative Dental Pain

lead_sponsor.agency: Johnson & Johnson Healthcare Products Division of McNEIL-PPC, Inc.

collaborator.agency: Johnson & Johnson Consumer and Personal Products Worldwide

clinical_study.source: Johnson & Johnson Consumer and Personal Products Worldwide

brief_summary.textblock: This is a dental pain study evaluating the efficacy and safety of a single dose of test acetaminophen (ACE) (1000 mg) compared to commercial acetaminophen (1000 mg), ibuprofen (IBU) (400 mg), and placebo over a 6 hour period. Subjects will undergo dental extraction of three or four third molars.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Time weighted sum of pain intensity difference from 0-6 hours (SPID 0-6)
primary_outcome.description: Time weighted sum of pain intensity difference scores from baseline over 6 hours. Pain intensity was evaluated using a 0-10 pain intensity numerical rating scale (PI-NRS) where 0 = no pain and 10 = very severe pain

secondary_outcome.measure: Time weighted sum of pain intensity difference from 0-4 hours (SPID 0-4)
secondary_outcome.description: Time weighted sum of pain intensity difference scores from baseline over 4 hours. Pain intensity was evaluated using a 0-10 pain intensity numerical rating scale (PI-NRS) where 0 = no pain and 10 = very severe pain

Minutes until meaningful pain relief are achieved. Stopwatch is started after the subject takes the study medication. The subjects are instructed to stop the stopwatch when the relief from the starting pain is meaningful to them.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to first perceptible pain relief
secondary_outcome.description: Minutes until first perceptible pain relief is achieved. Stopwatch is started after the subject takes the study medication. The subject is instructed to stop the stopwatch when they first begin to feel any pain relief.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to confirmed first perceptible relief
secondary_outcome.description: Minutes until confirmed first perceptible pain relief are achieved. Stopwatch is started after the subject takes the study medication. The subject is instructed to stop the stopwatch when they first begin to feel any pain relief. The first perceptible pain relief is confirmed if the subject also stopped the second stopwatch indicating meaningful pain relief.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time weighted sum of pain relief from 0-4 (TOTPAR 0-4)
secondary_outcome.description: Time weighted sum of pain relief scores over four hours. Pain relief was evaluated using a 0-10 pain relief numerical rating scale (PR-NRS) where 0 = no relief and 10 = complete relief

secondary_outcome.measure: Time weighted sum of pain relief from 0-6 (TOTPAR 0-6)
secondary_outcome.description: Time weighted sum of pain relief scores over six hours. Pain relief was evaluated using a 0-10 pain relief numerical rating scale (PR-NRS) where 0 = no relief and 10 = complete relief

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of relief after dosing (time to rescue analgesic)
secondary_outcome.description: Minutes until rescue medication is given

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects taking a rescue analgesic by 6 hours
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of subjects using rescue medication through six hours

secondary_outcome.measure: Subject Global Evaluation assessed at hour 6 or at time of rescue
secondary_outcome.description: Patient assessment of the pain medication - number of subjects rating the medication they received as a pain reliever on a score of 0-4, where 0=poor, 1=fair, 2=good, 3=very good, 4=excellent

intervention.description: 2 Test ACE 500 mg tablets taken orally one time
2 ACE 500 mg caplets taken orally one time
2 IBU 200 mg soft-gels taken orally one time
2 placebo caplets for acetaminophen taken orally one time
2 placebo soft-gels for ibuprofen taken orally one time
2 placebo tablets for Test acetaminophen taken orally one time

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Are 17 to 50 years of age
2. Weigh 100 lbs or greater and body mass index (BMI) 18 to 30 (inclusive)
3. Dental extraction of three or four third-molars.
4. Experience moderate to severe pain after extraction of third molars
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Currently pregnant (or planning to be pregnant) or nursing a baby
2. Known allergy to acetaminophen (ACE) or non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs)
3. Inability to swallow whole large tablets or capsules
4. Have other conditions that the investigator feels may impact subject's safety and/or the integrity of the study

overall_official.affiliation: McNeil Consumer Healthcare Division of McNEIL-PPC, Inc.

clinical_study.keyword: Molar,third; Teeth,wisdom; Pain, Postoperative; Dental Surgery; Third molar extraction
